### Equations in three unknowns

```{r}
library(matlib)
```

Given a system of equations,

$$
\begin{alignat*}{7}
2x &&\; + \;&& y  &&\; -z &&\; = \;&& 8  \\
-3x &&\; - \;&& y &&\; +2z  &&\; = \;&& -11 \\
-2x &&\; + \;&& y &&\; +2z &&\; = \;&& -3
\end{alignat*}
$$  
And here is the augmented matrix

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
	2 & 1 & -1 \\
  -3 & -1 & 2 \\
  -2 & 1 & 2
  \end{bmatrix}
    \begin{bmatrix}
	  x_{1} \\
    x_{2} \\
    x_{3}
\end{bmatrix}
	=
	\begin{bmatrix}
	8 \\
	-11\\
	-3
	\end{bmatrix}
$$
#### Create and show the equation
```{r}
A <- matrix(c(2,1,-1,-3,-1,2,-2,1,2),3,3, TRUE)
b <- c(8,-11,-3)
showEqn(A,b)
```
#### Find solution
```{r}
Solve(A,b)
```      

#### Plot the equation
```{r}
plotEqn3d(A,b)
```
#### Reduced echelon form
```{r}
echelon(A, b, verbose=TRUE, fractions=TRUE)
```
